Identification_Area.title: KPNO McMath-Pierce Solar Main Telescope (1.61m) Vacuum Spectrograph

Modification_Detail.description: Initial creation of the context product. Information from websites: https://www.nso.edu/telescopes/legacy-telescopes-2/ and https://www.noao.edu/kpno/

Instrument.name: Vacuum Spectrograph
Instrument.description: The third mirror of the McMath-Pierce main telescope sends light down into the observing room can be moved above three different positions. Two of these have a vacuum spectrograph beneath them, one of 18 meter deep and the other 4 meter deep with lower resolution but higher light throughput. These two spectrographs are able to rotate to compensate for the rotation of the image caused by the use of a heliostat. The third position can only be equipped with a static optical table with no image rotation correction and is therefore rarely used.
